file_content.text: Before we begin your briefing, I want to make something clear: The situation on Nar Shaddaa is very delicate.
This moon belongs to the Hutt Cartel, who take their neutrality very seriously. The Republic cannot afford any incidents.
I won't cause any trouble.
Understood, sir.
Cause any trouble the mission requires. Just don't get caught.
What exactly should I be avoiding here, sir?
Define "incident."
Imperial personnel operate just as freely on Nar Shaddaa as we do. You cannot be caught taking action against them.
Does it really matter if a bunch of Hutts are happy with us?
Why do we care?
The underworld has its uses, especially in times of war.
Now, your mission: An experimental Republic war droid has gone rogue, committing a series of seemingly random attacks across Nar Shaddaa.
The droid's designation is M1-4X, and it is my belief that this droid is acting under orders from Harron Tavus.
Do we know anything about the war droid's capabilities?
What are the M1-4X's specs?
How is Tavus involved?
A single droid? Are we really wasting time on this?
Doesn't sound like a big deal.
The droid is a highly advanced prototype, one that was being developed to serve in Havoc Squad.
The project was supposed to have been canceled, but it would seem Tavus simply shifted the development elsewhere--most likely his allies in the Sith Empire.
What are my orders, General?
How should I proceed?
Why wasn't the project completed in the first place?
Why the cancellation?
The droid's design relied on an exotic alien power source, but our technicians couldn't make it work efficiently.
How could this get by unnoticed?
This is ridiculous.
Tavus and his followers are experts in covert operations--expertise they learned from us.
This war droid's rampage must be stopped before it's linked with the Republic. An agent of the Strategic Information Service will be assisting you.
Officially, you're providing military support to an SIS operation. Do not divulge Tavus's defection, or the droid's connection to it.
You can count on me, sir.
No problem.
That's going to make this interesting.
Uh, okay.
General, if I may say so, this is highly irregular. Withholding relevant information from our allies is a violation of Regulation 32-C....
Intelligence Service should know everything we know.
I don't like this.
The lieutenant is correct, General. Regulation 32-C requires us to share all relevant intelligence.
SpecForce deals with its own problems, Sergeant Dorne. The SIS already knows everything it needs to know.
We deal with our own problems, Lieutenant. The last thing we need is for the SIS to get involved.
Be careful, Lieutenant. If this war droid is even half as dangerous as its original designers had estimated, you'll have your work cut out for you. Garza out.
Lieutenant. This is General Garza. I see that you've touched down on Nar Shaddaa.
Your contact is a field agent named Jonas Balkar. He'll meet you at a cantina located in the Duros Sector and provide further details.
